question_stem.en: A 4-year-old male is exposed to latex gloves during a minor surgical procedure and is subsequently found to produce anti-latex IgM antibodies. Several months later he develops a severe allergic reaction to latex and is found to have a high level of serum anti-latex IgE antibodies.
question_stem.zh: 一名4岁男性在一次小手术中接触了乳胶手套，随后被发现产生抗乳胶IgM抗体。几个月后，他出现了严重的乳胶过敏反应，并被发现血清中抗乳胶IgE抗体水平很高。

question.en: Which of the following cytokines is most likely responsible for this anti-latex antibody isotype change?
question.zh: 以下哪种细胞因子最有可能导致这种抗乳胶抗体同型转变？

explanation.en:
IL-4 stimulates the proliferation and differentiation of T_0 (naive) T cells into T_H2 lymphocytes, thus increasing the T_H2 subpopulation and the stimulus for the primary humoral immune response (eg, IgM). It also induces B cell proliferation and immunoglobulin class switching to IgE which is responsible for the TYPE I HYPERSENSITIVITY reaction following repeated exposure to an allergen. IL-5 contributes to B cell differentiation in addition to its role in stimulating IgA production and eosinophil activity (eg, host defense against parasitic infections). {{exhibit_1}}

(Choice A) IL-1 is produced by macrophages. It activates naive T_0 lymphocytes and promotes their differentiation into T_H1 and T_H2 subpopulations. IL-1 is also an endogenous pyrogen.

(Choice B) IL-2 is the first interleukin produced by T cells after contact with antigen. It is secreted mainly by T_H1 cells and stimulates development of CD4+ T helper cells, CD8+ cytotoxic cells, and B cells.

(Choice C) IL-3 stimulates growth and differentiation of bone marrow stem cells and is produced by T helper cells.

(Choice E) IL-10 helps regulate the balance between the T_H1 and T_H2 subpopulations of T helper cells. It is produced by T_H2 lymphocytes and inhibits synthesis of interferon-γ leading to a decrease in the T_H1 subpopulation. IL-10 also plays a part in class switching from IgM to IgG antibodies.

(Choice F) IL-12 is synthesized by macrophages and stimulates growth and development of the T_H1 subpopulation of T helper cells.

Educational Objective:
IL-4 is produced by the T_H2 subset of T helper cells. It facilitates proliferation of B cells and T_H2 lymphocytes and stimulates antibody isotype switching to IgE which mediates type I hypersensitivity (allergic) reactions.
explanation.zh:
IL-4 刺激 T_0（初始）T细胞增殖和分化为 T_H2 淋巴细胞，从而增加 T_H2 亚群，并刺激主要的体液免疫反应（例如，IgM）。它还诱导 B 细胞增殖和免疫球蛋白类别转换至 IgE，IgE 负责在反复接触过敏原后发生的 I 型超敏反应。IL-5 有助于 B 细胞分化，此外还可刺激 IgA 的产生和嗜酸性粒细胞的活性（例如，针对寄生虫感染的宿主防御）。{{exhibit_1}}

（选项 A）IL-1 由巨噬细胞产生。它激活初始 T_0 淋巴细胞并促进其分化为 T_H1 和 T_H2 亚群。IL-1 也是一种内源性致热原。

（选项 B）IL-2 是 T 细胞在与抗原接触后产生的第一个白细胞介素。它主要由 T_H1 细胞分泌，并刺激 CD4+ 辅助 T 细胞、CD8+ 细胞毒性细胞和 B 细胞的发育。

（选项 C）IL-3 刺激骨髓干细胞的生长和分化，并由辅助 T 细胞产生。

（选项 E）IL-10 有助于调节辅助 T 细胞的 T_H1 和 T_H2 亚群之间的平衡。它由 T_H2 淋巴细胞产生，抑制干扰素-γ 的合成，导致 T_H1 亚群减少。IL-10 也在 IgM 向 IgG 抗体的类别转换中发挥作用。

（选项 F）IL-12 由巨噬细胞合成，并刺激辅助 T 细胞的 T_H1 亚群的生长和发育。

教学目标：
IL-4 由辅助 T 细胞的 T_H2 亚群产生。它促进 B 细胞和 T_H2 淋巴细胞的增殖，并刺激抗体同型转换至 IgE，从而介导 I 型超敏反应（过敏）反应。

summary.en:
This question tests the role of cytokines in T helper cell differentiation and antibody isotype switching, specifically focusing on the cytokine responsible for IgE production in type I hypersensitivity reactions. Understanding the function of IL-4 in promoting B cell proliferation and IgE class switching is crucial.

To solve this question, recall that type I hypersensitivity reactions involve IgE. Then, remember that IL-4 is the key cytokine that stimulates B cells to switch to IgE production. Eliminate other options based on their known functions in immune responses.
summary.zh:
此问题考察细胞因子在辅助 T 细胞分化和抗体同型转换中的作用，特别关注负责 I 型超敏反应中 IgE 产生的细胞因子。了解 IL-4 在促进 B 细胞增殖和 IgE 类别转换中的功能至关重要。

要解决这个问题，请回忆 I 型超敏反应涉及 IgE。然后，记住 IL-4 是刺激 B 细胞转换为产生 IgE 的关键细胞因子。根据其他选项在免疫反应中的已知功能，排除它们。
